events.title: 25 Hours of Java
events.description: Celebration of Java's 25th birthday with technical deep dives (Java 9-14, upcoming features, JUnit 5), guests (Brian Goetz, Trisha Gee, Venkat Subramaniam, and more), and cake. Details: https://bit.ly/25hJava

events.title: Tonite #WithMe
events.description: Hanging out with Markus Karg, chatting about pattern matching in Java

events.title: AMA with Brian Goetz
events.description: Interested in where Java is going, or the motivation for some of its past choices? Brian Goetz, who lead the evolution of the Java Language is here to answer your questions!

events.title: 26 Hours of Java
events.description: Celebration of Java's 26th birthday with live programming, technical deep dives, and guests. Details: https://bit.ly/26h-java

events.title: AMA with Brian Goetz
events.description: This is an opportunity to ask questions of Brian Goetz, Architect for the Java Language at Oracle, all your questions about the history, evolution, and future of Java!

events.title: Accento
events.description: A conference I co-organize: 3 tracks with 15 slots, focussing on **Java** with a spicy side dish of **JavaScript** and **operations**, aimed at experienced and expert-level developers.

events.title: Java 18 AMA on Twitter
events.description: And if I'm not enough for you, there's this Twitter Space with Billy Korando and a few OpenJDK developers where we talk about JDK 18 nd answer all your questions about it.

events.title: JUG Karlsruhe Sommeredition
events.description: JUG Karlsruhe hangs out on Disy's rooftop with drinks and food

events.title: 28 Hours of Java
events.description: We're celebrating Java's 28th birthday with a 28-hour live stream with guests, games, presentations, conversations, and lots of Java code.

events.title: Accento
events.description: A conference I co-organize: 2 tracks with 10 slots, focussing on **Java** with a spicy side dish of **web dev**, aimed at experienced and expert-level developers.

events.title: Java 21 Release Party
events.description: We're celebrating Java's 21st feature release with an 8-hour live stream with technical explorations, expert interviews, and community voices.
